thread.title: Fox News celebrates Trump's weekend White House stay, except he was golfing
thread.title_full: Fox News celebrates Trump's weekend White House stay, except he was golfing

author: Nicole Gallucci
title: Fox News celebrates Trump's weekend White House stay, except he was golfing
text:
News Alert: Golfing for pleasure is actually not the same as working.
That should go without saying, but after Fox News claimed in a news alert that President Donald Trump was "working" in the White House all weekend, when in fact, he was golfing , here we are.
SEE ALSO: New 'Tiny Trumps' meme has flooded the internet big time
On Sunday evening, Fox News tweeted an extremely important news alert informing everyone that Trump did something unbelievable — he stayed in the White House to work for a weekend.
O.M.G.
The president staying in the nation's capital for the weekend had been considered completely normal and even routine for every president before him. For Trump, who usually spends his weekends at his "Winter White House" in Mar-a-Lago, this seemed groundbreaking. Sad!
News Alert: @POTUS spending weekend working at the White House. pic.twitter.com/kAtZVQE2Mr
— Fox News (@FoxNews) March 26, 2017
Right away, Twitter users began to troll Fox News for even dubbing Trump's run-of-the-mill presidential behavior as "newsworthy" in the first place, but after discovering the truth about his White House weekend, the drama escalated.
While Trump may have stuck around D.C. for the weekend, he wasn't always hard at work. Trump spent a good chunk of the weekend golfing at Trump National Golf Club, watching golf, thinking about golf — you know the drill.
A representative for Fox News did not immediately return a request for comment.
As you could imagine, Twitter users were quick to call out the alert for its failure to tell the whole truth, and um, well, being generally absurd.
No details from @WhiteHouse on today's @POTUS "meetings." Attire and mode of transport suggest more leisurely pursuits at his golf course. pic.twitter.com/A8SsM415Js
— Steve Herman (@W7VOA) March 25, 2017
Huh? He spent two days at the golf course https://t.co/Hdu1z4Nm65
— Justin Green (@JGreenDC) March 26, 2017
President was at Trump National for 55 minutes today. WH tells pool that he had three meetings. Instagram posts suggest he was watching golf pic.twitter.com/5R7k8yUF1Q
— Josh Billinson (@jbillinson) March 26, 2017
1) Even if this were true, why would it be news?
2) Not even true. https://t.co/6oHfunGbMj https://t.co/zvOYcyWcmG
— Chuds MacKenzie (@ChudsMacKenzie) March 26, 2017
BREAKING NEWS. President does his job at his taxpayer provided place of work. https://t.co/IgJy3pltdb
— Lydia Polgreen (@lpolgreen) March 26, 2017
Pool was told Trump was in meetings at Trump National this afternoon. This Instagram photo posted from the course says otherwise pic.twitter.com/WMudqofGmO
— Josh Billinson (@jbillinson) March 25, 2017
#TBT to when Trump and White House Press Secretary, Sean Spicer, called out President Obama for his various vacations and trips to the golf course.
Spicer said it best.
Wish I could be on the golf course but have to work - must be nice to be President
— Sean Spicer (@seanspicer) July 29, 2012
*Sighhhh*
WATCH: Esports bars bring fans together to socialize and game
